caller_intent: Anna seeks clarification on an existing insurance policy's coverage limits, cost, and payment options, and wants to adjust the policy's value and location details.
resolution_steps: Jason explains the policy covers actual cash value up to $50,000 for equipment loss or damage.
He retrieves the premium cost ($618 annually) and discusses payment options (annual or monthly).
Anna requests increasing the coverage limit to $60,000, prompting Jason to recalculate the premium.
Jason identifies a discrepancy in the policy's location (West Virginia vs. listed address) and updates the system.
He notes potential licensing issues for West Virginia and plans to confirm with upper management.
knowledge_required: Insurance policy terminology (actual cash value, replacement value)
State-specific licensing requirements for insurance agencies
systems_referenced: Insurance policy management system (for retrieving/updating policy details)
summary: Anna discusses an equipment insurance policy with Jason, clarifying coverage limits, costs, and payment options. She requests adjusting the policy's value and location, leading to a need to verify West Virginia licensing. Jason will follow up after confirming with management.
